title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.11.26 | 16-07-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyana Timiraandhasya Gyananjanishalakaya
Chakshurunmilitam Yena Tasvai Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnupadaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale
Shri Mate Bhakti Vedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine
Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Paschatya Deshatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda
Shri Advaita Gadadhara Shiva Sadhi Gauravakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya
Naram Chai Vanarottamam Deveem Saraswateem
Vyasam Tato Jaya Mudhirayet
In this session we will be discussing from the 26th verse of the 11th chapter of the 1st canto of Shri Madbhagavatam
Shriyo Nivaso Yasyo Raha
Paanapatram Mukham Drisham
Bahavo Lokapalanam
Saranganaam Padambujam
So here is a description of the Lord's beautiful form
The translation of this 26th verse
The Lord's chest is the abode of the goddess of fortune
His moon-like face is the drinking vessel of the moon
For eyes which hanker after all that is beautiful
His arms are the resting places for the administrative demigods
And his lotus feet are the refuge of pure devotees
Who never talk or sing of any subject except his lordship
So systematically the description is being given
Of the chest of the Lord
The moon-like face
His arms
And his lotus feet
Yasya
Uraha
Then Mukham
Then Bahavaha
And Padaambujam
So all the four are described very very nicely in this verse
So the chest is the abode of the goddess of fortune
The goddess of fortune
Nivasa
Sriaha
Nivasa
So the moon-like face is the drinking vessel for eyes
Which hanker after all that is beautiful
Our eyes are always searching
Seeking something beautiful to look at
But which is the most beautiful
Object of vision for our eyes
Is the eyes of the Lord
It is the Lord's form
And particularly the Lord's face
And his arms are the resting places for the administrative demigods
So Prabhupada explains in the purport what this means
The Lord gives all protection to the demigods
Who are engaged in administration of this universe
By the Lord's protection to the demigods
By the Lord's protection to the demigods
By actually giving protection through killing the demons
Either directly himself or through his agents
Through his empowered devotees
He kills the demons and he protects the devotees, the demigods
Then his lotus feet are the refuge of pure devotees
So the lotus feet are the refuge of pure devotees
So the lotus feet are the refuge of pure devotees
Eating the right ra voice
The positive Oczywiście
The pure devoteesalways take shelter of the Lord's lotus feet
And they always do discuss about the Supreme Lord
Their only topic of discussion are the Supreme Lord
dr 사람들
So the Purport Shila Prabhupada explains there are different classes of human beings all with different enjoyment from different objects
To seek new pleasures than обс cartridges
There are persons who are seeking after the favour of the goddess of fortune.
And for them, the Vedic literatures give information that the Lord is always served with all reverence
by thousands and thousands of the goddesses of fortune at the Chintamani Dhamma.
This is the verse in the Brahma Samhita, Chintamani prakara sadmasu kalpa vriksha lakshavrteshu
surabhi rabhi palayantam, lakshmi sahasra shata sambhrama sevya manam, lakshmi refers
to the goddess of fortune, sahasra shata, hundreds of thousands of goddesses of fortune
are serving him with great reverence, sambhrama sevya manam.
So if you want to know more about the goddess of fortune, you can click on the link in the
description below.
This description is there in the Brahma Samhita, the transcendental abode of the Lord where
the trees are all desired trees and the buildings are made of touchstone, Chintamani prakara
sadmasu.
The trees are desired trees.
They yield all kinds of desires.
They satisfy all kinds of desires.
The Lord Govinda is engaged there in herding the Surabhi cows as his natural occupation.
Surabhi rabhi palayantam lakshavrteshu.
He is surrounded by so many cows, beautiful cows, Surabhi cows.
And they yield so much milk, oceans of milk.
These goddesses of fortune can be saved.
They are seen automatically if we are attracted by the bodily features of the Lord.
There is no need to separately endeavour to have darshan of the beautiful goddess of fortune.
Simply darshan of the Lord's transcendental form means we can simultaneously have darshan
of the goddess of fortune because she always resides on the chest of the Lord.
Now, Srila Prabhupada makes a remark about the goddess of fortune.
He says, the impersonalists cannot observe such goddesses of fortune.
Why?
Because of their dry speculative habit.
So, the speculation leads them to conclude that absolute truth is impersonal.
No form, no personality.
This is their conclusion.
So, when they cannot see the form of the Lord, they can neither see the form of the goddess of fortune, the Goddess of Fortune.
This is their conclusion.
So, when they cannot see the form of the Lord, they can neither see the form of the Goddess of Fortune.
This is their conclusion.
So, when they cannot see the form of the Lord, they can neither see the form of the Goddess of Fortune.
Because she always resides on the chest of the Lord.
Now, there are artists who are overtaken by the beautiful creation, this material creation.
Prabhupada said, they should better see to the beautiful face of the Lord for complete satisfaction.
Prabhupada said, they should better see to the beautiful face of the Lord for complete satisfaction.
Artists want to paint something very beautiful. They admire the creation.
But millions and billions of times more beautiful is the beautiful face of the Lord.
Of course, the creation has got beauty, no doubt about it.
But that's just a reflection of the original beauty of the face of the Lord.
So whatever beauty we see in this material world is a reflection of the original beauty of the form of the Lord or the face of the Lord.
The face of the Lord is the embodiment of beauty.
All beauty is there in the face of the Lord.
What they call beautiful nature is but a smile.
What they call the sweet sounds of the birds are but specimens of the whispering voice of the Lord.
See, this is a description in the Bhagavatam second canto about the Lord's beauty and Lord's melodious voice
that is manifest in this material world as a reflection.
There are administrative demigods in charge of departmental service of cosmic management.
And there are tiny administrative gods in the state service.
They are always afraid of other competitors.
Those in position of power in this material world, they are fearful of competitors who may overtake them.
But if such administrative gods or administrative demigods, if they take shelter of the arms of the Lord,
the Lord can protect them always from the attacks of enemies.
This is always a fact.
Pure devotees always take shelter of the Supreme Lord's arms.
So pure devotees are never afraid.
Never afraid.
They are called abhaya, nirbhaya.
A faithful servant of the Lord engaged in the service of the administration is the ideal executive head
and can well protect the interest of the people in general.
Like Yudhishthira Maharaj, Parichit Maharaj.
They were ruling the whole world.
But because they had taken protection of the Supreme Lord,
they were able to give protection to the citizens.
They were able to give proper protection to the citizens.
Other so-called administrators are symbols of anachronisms leading to the acute distress of the people who are governed by them.
These materialistic administrators,
their own life is in danger.
What to speak of them giving protection to the citizens they are ruling?
It is not possible.
They cannot give real protection.
They may try,
but they are invariably defeated
by more powerful persons.
That's the nature of this material world.
But any administrator
can remain safely under the protection of the arms of the Lord.
That's what is meant by telling
his arms are the resting place for the administrative demigods.
The Lord's arms are
worthy of taking shelter because they can give protection to anyone and everyone
in this material world.
So,
Prabhupada explains the word
saranganam.
So Prabhupada says,
the essence of everything is the Supreme Lord
and therefore he is called saram.
Saram is the essence.
And those who sing and talk about him are called sarangas.
Or the pure devotees.
The pure devotees are called sarangas.
Because they are always
singing and glorifying and talking about
the Supreme Lord who is the essence of everything,
Sara.
So they are called sarangas.
The pure devotees are always
hankering after the lotus feet of the Lord.
Why?
Prabhupada explains,
the lotus has a kind of honey
which is transcendentally relished
by the devotees.
And the devotees are like bees
who are always after the honey
of the lotus feet of the Lord.
So,
Srila Prabhupada is quoting
the great devotee Acharya,
Srila Rupa Goswami.
He has sung a song
about the lotus honey
comparing himself to the bee.
Srila Rupa Goswami says in this song,
O my Lord Krishna,
I beg to offer my prayers unto you.
My mind is like the bee
and it is after some honey.
Kindly therefore give my bee mind
a place at your lotus feet,
which are the resources
for all transcendental honey.
I know that even big demigods
like Brahma do not see the rays
of the nails of your lotus feet,
even though they are engaged in deep meditation
for years and years together.
Still,
O infallible one,
my ambition is such,
for you are very merciful
to your surrendered devotees.
O Madhava,
I know also that I have no genuine devotion
for the service of your lotus feet.
But because your lordship
is inconceivably powerful,
you can do what is impossible to be done.
Your lotus feet can deride
even the nectar of the heavenly kingdom
and therefore I am very much attracted by them.
O Supreme Eternal,
please therefore let my mind be fixed
at your lotus feet
so that eternally I may be able to
relish the taste of your transcendental service.
This is the beautiful prayer offered by
Srila Rupa Goswami,
the Acharya in the Gaudiya Vaishnava Sampradaya.
So,
the devotees are satisfied
with being placed at the lotus feet of the Lord
because there is a certain honey
to be relished by the devotees
who take shelter at the lotus feet of the Lord.
I will stop here.
Thank you very much.
Hare Krishna.
